revised_title: Lunar Tide in Earth's Atmosphere: A Review of Determinations and Geographical Distribution
tldr: This article summarizes the current understanding of the lunar tide in Earth's atmosphere, focusing on the amplitude and phase of the lunar half-daily variation of barometric pressure. The author presents reliable determinations of the tide for various stations and discusses the geographical distribution, highlighting the need for further research and more accurate measurements.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
